messages: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:27): 171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39: I'm wondering why animations aren't flat out defined in an at-rule instead of having the keyframes in an at-rule and all the other relevant info munged into comma-separated properties on the selector
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:27): Presumably for flexibility.
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:28): You can pulse different number of times, different durations, etc.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:29): well, have an @rule for keyframes then
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:29): and another one for named animations
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:29): @keyframes { ... }
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:29): @animation throb { ... }
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:30): I don't think you're gaining anything over specifying the animation properties then.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:30): you gain not having so many properties
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:30): Is that a problem?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:30): you're proposing to multiply by three
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:30): yes
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:31): it's a lot of overhead
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:31): The alternative is to put them together, but have a way of specifying whether it's an in, out, or during animation.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:32): also, comma-separated lists are unweildy
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:32): if you have an @rule, you can define a more sane syntax
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:32): You'd need comma separated lists anyway, no?  To separate out multiple animations?  Or are you thinking just a space-separate list of animations?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:32): yeah, but then it's just a list of animation names
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:33): you dont' have to match up across properties
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:33): This wouldn't make transitions any less full-of-properties.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:33): it would
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:33): why wouldn't it?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:34): If you define stuff in an at-rule and reference it later, the stuff in the at-rule isn't a property
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:34): @font-face defines a bunch of stuff
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:34): Transitions would still need their (somewhat smaller) set of properties, since they don't do anything with keyframes or animations at all.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:34): well, yeah
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:34): and for more complicated things they can use the same syntax to get names and timing functions and stuff
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:35): I think animations only have two more properties beyond transitions, though.  Is that enough to justify changing how you treat their shared properties?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:37): yeah, I don't know
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:37): btw, one thing I don't like in your proposal is that that you have to know the duration of the play-in animation in order to time the play-during one
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:38): seems like there should be some automatic way to handle that
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:38): also
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:38): hooking together three animations requires that they connect up in a reasonable way, no?

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:39): you can't stop anytime in the middle of play-during and immediately start play-out if they're animating the same properties, otherwise it'll skip frames or something
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:39): Mm, true about needing an automatic way to start a play-during animation.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:40): anyway, I don't really have intelligent comments to make on this stuff. should go back and finish the minutes
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:40): hopes she can find all the relevant IRC logs
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:41): Perhaps one could leave the "from" keyframe selector out, and automatically grab the value that the previous class of animation had?
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:41): I think there might be some nice automatic way to smoothly transition between animations.
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:41): (pun intended)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:46): thinks transitioning animation-duration will lead to some interesting effects
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:47): I think the draft actually says that the values of the animation-* properties are frozen when the animation starts.  ^_^
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:47): (for the purposes of that animation)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:47): oh, so you can't slow something down as you unhover?
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (09:48): luckily, no ^_^
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (09:53): So what if I want to spin down a spinny thing as you unhover?
